item.title: Simple Divisibility Checker
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Enum, post:8, topic:48172”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=67410.msg794016#msg794016 date=1169272910]
mopar you talk bullshit, it doesn’t improve the code at all, it’s just a programming “standard”, package access is used alot in libraries where everything is done for you, and the intentions are for you to use those methods and nothing more, but the package needs to access these things to function the methods etc.
[/quote]

Though programming standards should be used, it’s not always the right way to do things.[/quote]

/reads first post and sees the it’s one of my FIRST programs when i didnt know shit.

item.title: Simple Divisibility Checker
item.dc:creator: @Goat_Spirit Goat Spirit
item.description:
@Goat_Spirit wrote:

[quote=“ilyaostr9, post:3, topic:48172”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=67410.msg779758#msg779758 date=1168938055]
The only comment I will make on your code is:

static int checkWhat;
static int checkBy;

That by default sets those variables to package access, which is very very rarely used in Java. In the case of the program you wrote they should be:

private static int checkWhat;
private static int checkBy;

It does not matter in your current code, but in the future when you start making bigger and bigger programs you will want to properly encapsulate your variables.

Otherwise the code doesn’t look too bad for a start, perhaps check that the input is in fact valid and I don’t enter a letter or something.
[/quote]
Ahem, I said simple, and this was actually one of my very first programs that were “independent” (that I wrote myself). There’s a lot of shit I can improve on, such as a GUI, and checking for invalid input. I’m probably gonna fix this up A LOT, and release this with a brand-spankin-new LookAndFeel (which I’m working on) and my “intelligent” calculator (PEMDAS Support, etc.), plus my other “mini-calculators” (this is one of em)[/quote]
Seems like someone has a new a cool idea in thier thinking. Glad your excited.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Divisibility Checker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The only comment I will make on your code is:

static int checkWhat;
static int checkBy;

That by default sets those variables to package access, which is very very rarely used in Java. In the case of the program you wrote they should be:

private static int checkWhat;
private static int checkBy;

It does not matter in your current code, but in the future when you start making bigger and bigger programs you will want to properly encapsulate your variables.

Otherwise the code doesn’t look too bad for a start, perhaps check that the input is in fact valid and I don’t enter a letter or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Divisibility Checker
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Enjoy, no command line arguments

[code]package com.io9Labs.simpleshit;

import java.util.Scanner;

/**

  • SimpleDivisibilityChecker, as the title suggests, is a simple

  • divisibility checker written in Java =P
    /
    public class SimpleDivisibilityChecker {
    /    *

    • The main() method which is called by the JVM when the application starts

    *@param args The arguments passed by the JVM from the command line
    */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
    checkDivisibility();
    }

    /**

    • Checks divisibility lol. =D
      */
      public static void checkDivisibility() {
      getValues();
      if((checkWhat % checkBy) > 0)
      System.out.println(“Sorry, but " + checkWhat + " is not fully divisible by " + checkBy + " D’=”);
      else
      System.out.println(“Yes! " + checkWhat + " is divisible by " + checkBy + " with a remainder of 0! =D”);
      }

    /**

    • lels gets value using a java.util.Scanner object
      */
      public static void getValues() {

      Scanner getter = new Scanner(System.in);

      System.out.print("Please enter what number to check for divisibility (Whole numbers only please :]): ");
      checkWhat = getter.nextInt();

      System.out.print("\n\n\n");
      System.out.print(“Check if number is divisible by: “);
      checkBy = getter.nextInt();
      System.out.print(”\n”);
      }

    static int checkWhat;
    static int checkBy;
    }[/code]

Read full topic
